intro: Eugenia martiusiana, commonly known as the Java apple or Malabar plum, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically red or yellow when ripe, containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine in some regions.
